required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of THC on Emotional Memory Retrieval
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Δ⁹-Tetrahydrocannabinol on the Retrieval of Emotional Memories

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to examine the effects of THC on the retrieval of emotional and neutral memories in healthy young adults.

detailed_description.textblock: Here, the investigators aimed to investigate the effects of THC (15 mg) on the retrieval of negative, neutral, and positive memories. The study used a placebo-controlled, within-subjects, crossover design with 23 participants. In each experimental arm, participants attend a session to encode stimuli and a second session 48 hours later in which their memories are tested for the stimuli from the first session. In the second session, two hours prior to memory testing, THC or placebo is administered. On all sessions subjects complete mood questionnaires.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Half of the participants will receive placebo during the retrieval session in the first experimental arm and THC during the retrieval session in the second experimental arm. The other half of participants will receive THC during the retrieval session in the first experimental arm and placebo during the retrieval session in the second experimental arm.
study_design_info.masking_description: A lab member that knew the design of the study but was not running participants sorted placebo and THC capsules into bags labeled "first capsule and "second capsule" for each participant.

primary_outcome.description: Hit and false alarm rates for negative, neutral, and positive picture stimuli

primary_outcome.time_frame: Two and a half hours after placebo/THC administration.
primary_outcome.description: Hit and false alarm rates for the DRM task

secondary_outcome.measure: Addiction Research Centre Inventory Marijuana Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed just prior to placebo/THC administration and then 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes, and 115 minutes after placebo/THC administration.
secondary_outcome.description: The Addiction Research Centre Inventory (ARCI; Martin, Sloan, Sapira, & Jasinski, 1971) measures drug-specific effects on a 56-item true-false questionnaire. For this study, the investigators report the composite score of 12 questions that make up the marijuana scale (Chait, Fischman, & Schuster, 1985).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed just prior to placebo/THC administration and then 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes, and 115 minutes after placebo/THC administration.
secondary_outcome.description: The Visual Analog Scales (VAS; Folstein & Luria, 1973) is composed of thirteen adjectives used to assess individual dimensions of subjective mood - anxious, stimulated, sedated, elated, insightful, sociable, confident, lonely, playful, dizzy, loving, friendly, and restless, rated on a sliding scale from 'not at all' to 'extremely.'

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed just prior to placebo/THC administration and then 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes, and 115 minutes after placebo/THC administration.
secondary_outcome.description: The Drug Effects Questionnaire (DEQ; Morean et al., 2013) is composed of five questions concerning current drug effects - how much participants feel a drug effect, like the effect, dislike the effect, feel high, and want more of the drug, rated on a sliding scale from 'not at all/neutral' to 'very much.'

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed just prior to placebo/THC administration and then 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes, and 115 minutes after placebo/THC administration.
Assessed just prior to placebo/THC administration and then 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes, and 115 minutes after placebo/THC administration.

arm_group.description: Participants came in for an encoding session, followed 48 hours later by a retrieval session. Participants received a placebo capsule (dextrose) during the retrieval session, 2 hours prior to their memories being tested. Participants were monitored for the next 2 hours including physiological and subjective measures every 30 minutes. After 2 hours, participants' memory for the emotional stimuli and Deese-Roediger-McDermott (DRM; a false memory task) stimuli was tested. After the memory tests and 3.5 hours post-capsule, if participants' physiological and subjective measures had returned to baseline, they were allowed to leave. Other than the capsule, this arm was identical to the THC arm.

Participants came in for an encoding session, followed 48 hours later by a retrieval session. Participants received a capsule containing THC (dronabinol) during the retrieval session, 2 hours prior to their memories being tested. Participants were monitored for the next 2 hours including physiological and subjective measures every 30 minutes. After 2 hours, participants' memory for the emotional stimuli and Deese-Roediger-McDermott stimuli was tested. After the memory tests and 3.5 hours post-capsule, if participants' physiological and subjective measures had returned to baseline, they were allowed to leave. Participants were monitored for the next 2 hours including physiological and subjective measures every 30 minutes. Other than the capsule, this arm was identical to the Placebo arm.

intervention.description: A capsule that contains 15 mg of THC as well as dextrose filler administered 2 hours prior to memory testing.
A capsule that contains only dextrose filler administered 2 hours prior to memory testing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 4-100 lifetime cannabis occasions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current Axis I DSM-IV disorder, including substance dependence, current use of >5 cigarettes per day, history of psychosis or mania, less than a high school education, lack of English fluency, a body mass index outside 19-33 kg/m2, high blood pressure (>140/90), abnormal electrocardiogram, daily use of any medication other than birth control, pregnancy, or lactating.

patient_data.ipd_description: The investigators have shared all of the data to https://osf.io/e6b5k/
